original_title: The Czech delegation got acquainted with the Korean artillery
original_description: The visit to South Korea was to take place at the end of November, during which the Czech delegation visited several industrial companies such as Hyundai Rotem, Gyeongsangnam-do and Hanwha Aerospace. In addition, they visited the Doosan Energy Changwon company, which deals with the energy sector, in this case the aim was to familiarize themselves with, among other things, nuclear energy in the context of modular nuclear reactors (including SMRs). This was related to further negotiations on the creation of a nuclear power plant in the Czech Republic in cooperation with South Korea (the whole under the management of the Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power consortium).
ai_title: Czech Delegation Explores Korean Artillery and Energy
ai_summary: A Czech delegation visited South Korea to explore artillery and energy technologies, including modular nuclear reactors, for potential cooperation.

original_title: Poland – Morocco: Untapped Potential for Cooperation
original_description: The outbreak of the largest European war since the conflict of 1939-1945 marked a wake-up call for many nations and their policymakers. Since 2022, Polish foreign policy and diplomacy have been primarily focused on Eastern Europe and issues directly or indirectly linked to the Russian-Ukrainian war. This focus was evident in the 2024 policy address by Polish Foreign Minister Radosław Sikorski, where other global regions (apart from the Indo-Pacific) were mentioned only briefly. However, in competing with Moscow, it is crucial to engage partners located thousands of kilometers away from Warsaw. Morocco, the most pro-Western country in North Africa, is one such partner.
ai_summary: Poland's focus on Eastern Europe should expand to include Morocco for strategic cooperation.

original_title: The World Through the Eyes of the Russian Intelligence Chief

ai_summary: Sergei Naryshkin, head of Russia's SVR, shares his vision of the world, hinting at Russia's future policy directions.

original_title: The war in Ukraine shows the necessary changes in the field of European security
original_description: - Our approach is guided by the principle of continuing those actions that are beneficial and rectifying those that are detrimental. As General Kukuła observed, the lessons of the war in Ukraine are being implemented. It would be erroneous to assume that a one-off solution is being adopted - rather, flexibility is required. The ability to adapt is of paramount importance in order to ensure that the military is able to respond effectively to changing circumstances. (…) After two years and, in a moment, after three years of experience of the war in Ukraine, there must be an analysis and redefinition of the actions we are conducting - stated Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz at the conference "Lessons from the war in Ukraine – equipment and structure of the Polish army and Civil Defence".
ai_title: European Security Lessons from Ukraine War
ai_summary: Polish leaders discuss adapting military strategies based on ongoing conflict in Ukraine.

original_title: Minister Jacek Siewiera: Ukraine should join NATO
original_description: The possibility of the UA joining NATO is a multi-year process and requires the unity of allies. Today, it is not visible here. Although from the Polish perspective, it is necessary for the UA to be in the Alliance - emphasized Minister Jacek Siewiera, who was a guest on the morning show "Bez Uników" on Program 3 of Polish Radio. As he added, what we can achieve in 2025 is a form of ceasefire in Ukraine - Russia will not withdraw, and retaking territories with the weapons that the Ukrainians have is not possible.
ai_summary: Polish Minister Jacek Siewiera advocates for Ukraine's NATO membership but acknowledges it's a lengthy process requiring allies' unity. Expects a ceasefire by 2025.

original_title: Modernization of C-295M CASA aircraft
original_description: On 13 December this year, an agreement for the modernisation and unification of C-295M CASA transport aircraft for the Polish Army was signed between the Armament Agency and the Spanish company Airbus Defence & Space, in the presence of Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defence Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz. The modernisation planned for 2025-2033 will apply to all 16 C-295M aircraft owned by Poland and used by the 8th Air Transport Base in Balice. The value of the contract is EUR 102.7 million net (approx. PLN 540 million gross).
ai_title: Poland to Modernize C-295M CASA Aircraft
ai_summary: Poland signs €102.7M deal with Airbus for modernizing 16 C-295M transport aircraft by 2033.

original_title: Don't buy under the tree. It could end badly
original_description: Don't buy a dog or cat for Christmas - animal advocates appeal, emphasizing that an animal is a family member and should not be a gift. After the holidays, animals often become an unwanted burden and are abandoned. Shelters across the country suspend adoptions during the holiday season for the same reason. "A shelter is not a toy store where we can fulfill our momentary whims," ​​we read on the website of the facility in Gaj.
ai_summary: Animal advocates urge against buying pets as gifts, as many end up abandoned post-holidays.

original_title: Barbara Stuhr: Jerzy's departure was so strange that he had the right not to notice it

ai_summary: Barbara Stuhr shares her experience with her husband's undetected dementia and his eventual passing, highlighting the subtle signs of the illness.
